meanings.definition: Showing a tendency to be irritable or unpleasant
meanings.sent1: She was in a bitchier mood than usual today.
meanings.sent2: Her sister can be even bitchier when she's tired.
meanings.sent3: The cat gave her a bitchier look than usual when she forgot to feed it.
meanings.sent4: The storm grew bitchier as the winds howled louder.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's tone became bitchier as the students continued to talk.

meanings.definition: Comparatively more irritable or unpleasant than someone or something else
meanings.sent1: His comments were bitchier than hers during the argument.
meanings.sent2: The new boss is even bitchier than the old one.
meanings.sent3: The weather seemed to get bitchier every time they planned a picnic.
meanings.sent4: The competition became bitchier as the stakes got higher.
meanings.sent5: The traffic grew bitchier as rush hour approached.
